Activity2.Description: GOODALL HEALTH PARTNERS CONSIST OF MANY PHYSICIANS WITH MULTI-SPECIALTY SERVICES IN DIFFERENT LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT YORK COUNTY. THESE PHYSICIANS COMPLIMENT THE HOSPITAL IN MAINTAINING ITS MISSION TO SERVE AS A LEADER IN IMPROVING THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF OUR COMMUNITY BY SERVING THE POPULOUS. THESE SPECIALTIES INCLUDE (BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO) CARDIOLOGY, ENT, FAMILY PRACTICES, INTERNAL MEDICINE, PEDIATRICS, ORTHO AND GENERAL SURGERY. THE NUMBER OF PATIENTS SEEN WERE 19,307 FOR A TOTAL NUMBER OF VISITS OF 55,762.

Activity3.Description: GOODALL HOSPITAL ELDERCARE SERVICES PROVIDE LONG-TERM CARE AND MEDICAL SERVICES TO OUR SENIOR CITIZENS. ELDERCARE HAD ADMITTED 253 RESIDENTS FOR A TOTAL OF 25,684 PATIENT DAYS. WE CONTINUE TO GROW AND ADAPT TO THE NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY WITH THIS SERVICE. GOODALL HOSPITAL ELDERCARE PRIDES THEMSELVES BY CREATING A HOME-LIKE, COMFORTABLE ENVIRONMENT FOR THE RESIDENTS AND STAFF. THE NEWTON CENTER FOR REHABILITATION AND NURSING CARE PROMOTES HIGH QUALITY CARE; WITH DEDICATED STAFF FAMILY EDUCATIONAL ND INVOLVEMENT MAKE THIS PROGRAM SPECIAL.

ActivityOther.Description: THE MEDICAL GROUP CONSISTS OF MANY PHYSICIANS WITH MULTI-SPECIALTY SERVICES THAT EXTEND GOODALL HOSPITAL'S EXISTING SERVICES TO KENNEBUNK, ME. THESE PHYSICIANS COMPLIMENT THE HOSPITAL IN MAINTAINING ITS MISSION TO SERVE AS A LEADER IN IMPROVING THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF OUR COMMUNITY. THESE SERVICES INCLUDE (BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO) FULL SERVICE PRIMARY CARE, WOMENS'S HEALTH, GASTROENTEROLGY, PULMONARY MEDICINE, ORTHOPEDICS AND PAIN MANAGEMENT. THE NUMBER OF PATIENTS SEEN WERE 9,543 FOR A TOTAL NUMBER OF VISITS OF 34,663.

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Henrietta D. Goodall Hospital, Inc.'s mission is to serve as a leader in improving the health and well-being of its community. THE HOSPITAL OPENED AN OUTPATIENT SERVICES FACILITY IN KENNEBUNK, MAINE ON SEPTEMBER 14, 2009, CALLED "GOODALL OUTPATIENT SERVICES." THIS FACILITY EXTENDS HENRIETTA D. GOODALL HOSPITAL'S OUTPATIENT SERVICES TO KENNEBUNK, MAINE, FOR CONVENIENT ACCESS FOR THE COMMUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDescription: HENRIETTA D. GOODALL HOSPITAL, INC. OWNS AND OPERATES H. D. GOODALL HOSPITAL, INC. (ACUTE CARE HOSPITAL), GOODALL HEALTH PARTNERS (A MULTI-SPECIALTY PHYSICIAN AND SURGEON GROUP), THE MEDICAL GROUP (A MULTI-SPECIALTY PHYSICIAN AND SURGEON GROUP), GOODALL OUTPATIENT CLINIC (A FACILITY WHERE A VARIETY OF OUTPATIENT SERVICES ARE PERFORMED), GOODALL OUTPATIENT SERVICES-WATERBORO AND GOODALL ELDERCARE SERVICES (A LONG TERM CARE FACILITY) IN YORK COUNTY. YORK COUNTY CONSISTS OF 18 TOWNS AND CITIES LOCATED ON THE SOUTHERN MAINE COAST WITH A POPULATION OF OVER 200,000. HENRIETTA D. GOODALL HOSPITAL, INC FURTHERS ITS MISSION AS A LEADER IN IMPROVING THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF THE COMMUNITY AND PROVIDES ACCESS TO NEEDED HEALTH CARE SERVICES 365 DAYS A YEAR, 24 HOURS A DAY.
IRS990.Description: GOODALL HOSPITAL IS A 58 BED HOSPITAL WHICH STRIVES TO MEET THE HEALTH CARE NEEDS OF INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THROUGHOUT YORK COUNTY. GOODALL HOSPITAL OFFERS A BROAD RANGE OF MEDICAL, SURGICAL, DIAGNOSTIC AND REHABILITATION SERVICES, WELLNESS EDUCATION, SUPPORT GROUPS AND OTHER COMMUNITY OUTREACH PROGRAMS. GOODALL HOSPITAL HAS HAD 22,271 EMERGENCY ROOM VISITS, 35,114 RADIOLOGY PROCEDURES, 341,907 LABORATORY PROCEDURES, 47,270 THERAPY PROCEDURES, 249 INFANTS BORN AND 2,586 SURGERY CASES. GOODALL HOSPITAL PROVIDED $882,162 IN CHARITY CARE TO THE COMMUNITY. THIS INCLUDES PATIENTS WHO ARE UNDERINSURED OR THOSE WITHOUT ANY INSURANCE. IN ADDITION TO THE CHARITABLE CARE SERVICES, WE ARE CONTINUALLY ABSORBING ALL THE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH PROVIDING THE COMMUNITY A VARIETY OF SPECIAL COMPLIMENTARY SERVICES. GOODALL PROUDLY SPONSORS COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, SCHOOL GROUPS, CIVIC ORGANIZATIONS AND SPECIAL EVENTS (LIKE THE LOCAL BASEBALL TEAM). GOODALL HOSPITAL SPONSORS TWO TO FOUR FREE EDUCATION EVENTS EACH MONTH OF THE YEAR ALONG WITH DOZENS OF SUPPORT GROUPS. GOODALL HOSPITAL ALSO ROUTINELY PARTICIPATES IN HEALTH FAIRS AND BUSINESS EVENTS, PERFORMING BLOOD PRESSURE CHECKS, CHOLESTEROL SCREENINGS AND CPR TRAINING. GOODALL HOSPITAL'S SENIOR ADVOCATE PROVIDES FREE ADVICE AND SERVICES TO ELDERLY MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY. SERVICES INCLUDE HELP WITH INSURANCE AND MEDICAL ISSUES, AS WELL AS PERSONAL ISSUES INCLUDING TAX INFORMATION, FINANCES AND HOME NEEDS.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: Henrietta D. Goodall Hospital, Inc. has a contract for government relations services with the Grinnell Associates (formally known as the Liberty Square Group) to identify, research and champion efforts for appropriation funding opportunities to meet the Hospital's goals and objectives, including facility development, system technology enhancements, equipment acquisition, wellness and community health and emergency preparedness.

Form990ScheduleHPartIV.DescriptionEntPrimaryActivity: Provide malpractice insurance for a group of health care providers

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.BadDebtFootnote: Part III, Line 4: Footnote concerning bad debts: Management monitors and evaluates its allowance for doubtful accounts to ensure that receivables are stated at their net realizable value. The costing methodology consists of applying a cost to charge ratio to the recorded provision for bad debt (representing uncollected charges) and charity care revenues based on cost report.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.ShortfallAsCommunityBenefit: Part III, Line 8: The costing methodology consists of applying a cost to charge ratio to inpatient and outpatient revenues based on Medicare cost report.The computed shortfall has not been included in community benefit.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.NeedsAssessment: Part VI, Line 2: Goodall Hospital's Board of Trustees is comprised of a diverse group of community members. The Board of Trustees provides insight and direction to the hospital. The hospital also participated in a community visioning session with the Town of Sanford and "Safe Schools, Healthy Students" to establish the Safe and Healthy Coalition. In addition, Goodall Hospital recognizes and acts on recommendations made by the Maine Center for Disease Control and Prevention and other external state groups such as the Health Maine Partnerships Collaborative.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PatientEducationAssistance: Part VI, Line 3: Goodall Hospital employs a financial counselor who assists and educates patients and their families on financial matters concerning the hospital charity care policy and eligibility for state and federal programs. This assistance can be as specific as assisting the patient and/or families in completing the various forms required by Medicaid and Medicare. The hospital's Senior Advocate program provides free advice and services to elderly members of the community. These services include assistance with insurance and medical issues, tax information, personal finances and home needs. The Senior Advocate has extensive knowledge of the issues facing seniors and can help with assessment of current needs and provide referrals to existing services.Goodall Hospital also provides a prescription assistance program called RX Assist. The program is designed to assist those who do not qualify for traditional assistance programs such as Medicare D or MaineCare. The program processed 1,438 prescriptions and saved patients $547,000.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityInformation: Part VI, Line 4: Goodall Hospital serves the population of western York County, Maine. Sanford is the town with the largest population in the hospital's service area. Sanford's population is approximately 22,000 with an elderly population rate of 16.2% and families representing 65.9% of the population. 95.1% of the population is white. The hospital's Medicaid volume of 21% is amongst the highest in the state and reflects the high percentage of families with income less than 100% of the Federal poverty level. Sanford's poverty rate is 16.4% for families and 17.8% for individuals. 56% of Sanford's elementary school children are eligible to receive free or subsidized meals. Sanford's unemployment rate of 10.1% exceeds the state's overall unemployment rate. Sanford has been hard hit by the foreclosure crisis and has the most home foreclosures of any of Maine's communities. Sanford has also been designated as a medically underserviced area.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityBuildingActivities: Part VI, Line 5: Community building activities are primarily administered through the hospital's Partners for Healthier Communities (PHC), a local Healthy Maine Partnership. Listed below are some of the recent programs provided by PHCSafe and Healthy Sanford Coalition: Collaborated with the Town of Sanford and Safe Schools, Health Students to create a community vision for healthy students. District Public Health Council: Worked collaboratively with Maine CDC and two other Health Maine Partnerships to co-convene a District Public Health Council service York County. Tobacco Cessation: Coordinated 8 classes at no charge to participants. Twenty-two individuals have completed the program. Trained three staff in tobacco cessation skills and provided education to the local community regarding the Maine Tobacco Helpline.Safe Routes to School: Coordinated this initiative for Sanford schools and assisted in the preparation of funding application.H1N1: Assisted the Maine CDC in dissemination of educational resources throughout the community.Worksite Wellness: Assisted seven worksites to establish or improve worksite wellness teams and action plans. School Health Coordinators: Funded School Health Coordinator position for Sanford schools. This position focuses on policy and environmental changes related to tobacco, physical activity and nutrition.Alcohol and Drug Awareness: Provided community information session on alcohol, marijuana and other dugs, responsible beverage seller and enforcement activities related to underage drinking patrols and education.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.OtherInformation: Part VI, Line 6: Goodall Hospital also provides the following in an effort to promote the health of the community through Maine Families York County:Prenatal Support: Free and voluntary service that provides prenatal support to first time parents up to the time their first child reaches age five. The program is accredited by Health Families America and also ahs certified parents as teachers/educators on its staff.Families READ Family Literacy Program: Provides parents with the opportunity to access educational services.Health Promotions: Completed 1,530 home visits to 159 community families that provide services such as identification of childhood developmental delays, breastfeeding and infant nutrition education, assistance to parents in determining risk levels associated with lead poisoning, and assitance to parents regarding shaken baby syndrome and home safety.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Member of Goodall's Board and former owner of The Medical Group.
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: Weber Shill has one outstanding loan with Henrietta D. Goodall Hospital Inc. for the purchase of The Medical Group. The original amount of the loan was $1,835,248 and as of May 31, 2010, the remaining balance of the loan was $1,567,591.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE HOSPITAL OPENED AN OUTPATIENT SERVICES FACILITY IN KENNEBUNK, MAINE, ON SEPTEMBER 14, 2009, CALLED "GOODALL OUTPATIENT SERVICES". THIS FACILITY EXTENDS HENRIETTA D. GOODALL HOSPITAL'S OUTPATIENT SERVICES TO KENNEBUNK, MAINE, FOR CONVENIENT ACCESS FOR THE COMMUNITY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Management reviews the 990 with its external auditors prior to submission. Management will make the 990 available for Board review prior to signature and submission of the return.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The hospital ensures that the conflict of interest policy is enforced by requiring board members to sign conflict of interest documents on a yearly basis. These documents are reviewed annually by management to identify any conflicts, actual or perceived, and to develop necessary resolutions for any indentified conflicts.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: 15a: The board of directors approves the compensation for the CEO after careful review of industry salary compensation information (compensation study) with an outside compensation consultant. 15b: Under the guidance of professional compensation consultants, the HR Director reviews the pay model with the CEO and COO to ensure that the Organization is able to recruit and retain a highly qualified workforce, while providing the necessary structure to effectively manage the competitive advantage of productivity, total quality, customer service and costs.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization will provide its Forms 1023, 990 and 990-T upon written request. It evaluates the reason for the request and deems whether it will offer these documents based on the intent and purpose of the request.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The hospital will provide its governing documents, financial statements and conflict of interest policy upon written request. It evaluates the reason for the request and deems whether it will offer these documents based on the intent and purpose of the request.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Description of compensation for Mark Rautenberg, M.D.
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Mark Rautenberg, M.D., Ex-Officio TRUSTEE and President of the Medical Staff, received compensation from the Organization for physician services rendered as an emergency department physician and president of the medical staff and not for services performed as a trustee.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Schedule K, Part I, column e
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Amounts listed as bond issue price do not match IRS Form 8038, Part III, line 21(b), as the Hospital was a part of a group of organizations participating in the revenue bonds issuance. Thus, the amount listed is the Hospital's portion of the total bond issue price.
